steps.description: Worker retrieves the PCB from the input stack or conveyor (from the left/rear).
Worker places the acquired PCB onto the designated assembly jig/fixture on the conveyor belt.
Worker repeatedly picks components from the supply tray and manually inserts them into the PCB's through-holes until all components required for this station are placed.
Worker performs a visual check for proper seating, alignment, and polarity of all inserted components.
Secure any necessary mechanical components (connectors, heatsinks) with screws/fasteners using a screwdriver.

Action involves a *lateral* push on the fixture/board edge, resulting in the board shifting its position on the conveyor, even if the shift is minor (1-2 rollers). Prioritize this if assembly is visually complete and a lateral push is detected.
steps.input_material_flow: Workstation Fixture to Output Conveyor (moving to the right/front)
